summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between a prosecutor and a defense attorney regarding the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death. It informs victims' counsel about a scheduled court conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment and reminds them of available victim resources, including counseling and travel assistance for attending the hearing.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge who scheduled a conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death and will allow victims to be heard during the proceeding.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI case agent who victims can contact to be put in touch with victim services for counseling.

persons.name: Esq.
persons.context: An attorney representing victims who responded to the prosecutor's email, thanking them for the offer of counseling and their dedication to the situation.

connections.description: The attorney's clients (victims) are being directed to contact the Special Agent for victim services, establishing a professional link between legal counsel and law enforcement support.
Judge Berman is presiding over the legal proceedings in which the attorney's clients (victims) may participate.

events.title: Court Conference on Dismissal
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. Victims are allowed to be heard directly or through counsel.

events.title: Email Offering Victim Resources
events.description: A prosecutor sent an email to victims' counsel reminding them that counseling and other victim services are available through the FBI case agent.

keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment following his death.
Judge Berman ruled that victims would be allowed to address the court directly or through their counsel during the proceeding.
The prosecution offered to arrange and fund travel for victims who wished to attend the conference but could not afford it.
The prosecution reminded victims' counsel that counseling and support services were available through the FBI case agent.
The correspondence highlights the procedural steps taken in the legal case after Epstein's death and the ongoing effort to involve victims.
